flashcards.english: Nīwahingūra? (Have you opened?) → Ndinahingūra (I have not opened) / Nīngūhingūrīte kabere (I opened earlier). Nī wethamba? (Have you bathed?) → Ndinethamba (I have not bathed) / Nīngwīthambīte kabere (I bathed earlier). Nīūrugire cai? (Have you made tea?) → Ndinaruga cai (I have not made tea) / Nīndugire cai hau kabere (I made tea earlier)
flashcards.notes: Perfect tense pattern: Nī + verb-ite (question) → Ndina + verb (negative) / Nī + verb-ite + kabere (affirmative past). Kabere = earlier. Shows three verbs: hĩngūra (open), ethamba (bathe), ruga (make)
